page.title: 10COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: The area is served by a local radio station Radio nan Eilean based in Stornoway.At 8.10am daily news bulletins are broadcast"Failte oirbh gu Aithris na Maidne an duigh an coigeamh latha deug den Og Mhios.Seo agaibh Cairistiona Nicaoidh leis na naidheachan".Welcome to this morning's news today the 15th of June.This is Christina Mackay with the days news. This station broadcasts several times a day with late night requests- Caithris na h-Oidhche.Two local newspapers serve the area-the Harris produced De Tha Dol?and the Stornoway Gazette.A sub post office was established in Tarbert in 1836. This is still the central post office,the rural areas are served by post vans.An exeption is the isolated village of Rhenigidale whose postman has a thrice weekly walk of 12miles over footpaths.
